title: APN-run retail fund rounds up petrol stations
text:
The APN Convenience Retail REIT is buying a group of 13 petrol stations across the country in a $74.6 million deal that will diversify the mix of tenants and regions in its portfolio.

The acquisitions include three petrol stations that are already trading. Another three are under construction and will be acquired upon completion, expected in late December. Seven sites are fund-through developments due to be completed by the middle of next year.

The APN-run fund which has acquired 13 petrol station properties has a portfolio dominated by Puma. Supplied

The average lease term across the entire group is 13.8 years. The series of deals will generate an initial yield of 6.2 per cent.

Before the latest acquisitions, the trust, which listed in July 2017 and is part of the APN Property-run stable of funds, owned 68 service station and convenience retail assets, most of them across the eastern seaboard of Australia.

The deals will be funded through a combination of debt and equity. The property trust, led by fund manager Chris Brockett, has launched a $38 million placement underwritten by Moelis Australia.
description: The $74.6 million portfolio comprises 10 development sites and three petrol stations which are already trading.
